intro: Gonostemon macowanii var. conformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gonostemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
